subject: [PATCH] nfsd: use dynamic allocation for oversized NFSv4.0 replay cache

reviews.author: Jeff Layton
reviews.summary: reviewer questioned the necessity of dynamic allocation for oversized replay cache, suggesting it may not be necessary if correctness is not a priority
reviews.raw_body:
Certainly a reasonable approach if we care about full correctness when
dealing with a large lockowner on NFSv4.0. Do we?
-- 
Jeff Layton <jlayton@kernel.org>

reviews.author: Chuck Lever (author)
reviews.summary: Author acknowledges that the patch is not suitable for backporting and suggests squashing it with another fix or backporting a different fix instead.
reviews.raw_body:
The idea would be to either:

o Backport your fix and not this update, or
o Squash these two together, and backport both

Admittedly this is a narrow corner case for a minor version that is
destined for the scrap heap.


-- 
Chuck Lever

reviews.author: Jeff Layton
reviews.summary: Reviewer Jeff Layton expressed skepticism about the patch's approach to handling oversized NFSv4.0 replay cache, suggesting that it may not be necessary and questioning whether any legitimate user would care.
reviews.raw_body:
Right. I ask because I looked at this approach when I was fixing this,
and decided it wasn't worthwhile. I certainly won't stand in your way
if you decide you want to handle long lockowner blobs, but I doubt any
legitimate user will ever care.
-- 
Jeff Layton <jlayton@kernel.org>

reviews.author: Chuck Lever (author)
reviews.summary: Author acknowledges a potential issue with replay compliance and suggests an alternative approach, but does not commit to revising the patch.
reviews.raw_body:
I don't disagree at all. My concern is handling replay compliantly.
Maybe there's another approach.


-- 
Chuck Lever

reviews.author: Jeff Layton
reviews.summary: Reviewer Jeff Layton expressed a neutral sentiment towards the patch, stating that while he doesn't have a problem with it, he didn't think it was worthwhile to fix the issue by dynamically allocating memory instead of increasing NFSD4_REPLAY_ISIZE.
reviews.raw_body:
I think that the only other way is to grow NFSD4_REPLAY_ISIZE, and
doing dynamic allocation is preferable to that, IMO.

To be clear: I don't have a problem with your patch. It just didn't
seem worthwhile to me. If you think it's worth fixing though, then go
for it.
-- 
Jeff Layton <jlayton@kernel.org>
